n implementation of an idea that Roy posted to a

to go if you want a key/value format

On Wed, Mar 21, 2012 at 10:24, Jorn Wildt <jw@...> wrote:
> > A=
 part of my current project is management of simple key/value properties (s=
tring/string) for (more or less) any resource in the system.
> >
> > My use=
-cases/scenarios are:
> >
> > 1) Some resource in the system contains a lin=
k with the rel-type "additional-properties". This link points to the list o=
f additional properties for that resource (at the URL "{additional-properti=
es}").
> >
> > 2) The URL "{additional-properties}" returns a list of key/v=
alue properties for reading.
> >
> > 3) For each key/value in the list ther=
e will be links for a) editing the value of the key, and 2) deleting the ke=
y.
> >
> > 3a) Editing is as simple as PUTing a new value to the URL.
> >
>=
 > 3b) Deleting a key is as simple as a HTTP DELETE of the URL.
> >
> > 4) =
The list also contains a link for adding new properties.
> >
> > What would=
 be a suitable (simple) media-type for this?
> >
> > I am considering ATOM =
(which is nice for lists), but that seems like quite a bit of overkill. HTM=
L might also be useful (but does not support PUT, but POST would be okay to=
o). A home-grown application/vnd.abc+xml is also a possibility.
> >
> > Wha=
t would you guys do?
> >
> > Thanks, J=F8rn
